support_summary: TDP-43 contains a nuclear localization signal (NLS) that is recognized by the Importin-α/β heterodimer, which mediates its transport into the nucleus.

functions.cellular_process: Importin-α, as part of the Importin-α/β heterodimer, recognizes and binds to the bipartite nuclear localization signal (NLS) of TDP-43, mediating its active transport from the cytoplasm into the nucleus through the nuclear pore complex.
functions.effect_description: This interaction is essential for maintaining the predominantly nuclear localization of TDP-43. Binding of Importin-α to the TDP-43 NLS also has a chaperone-like activity, disrupting the dimerization of TDP-43's N-terminal domain and thereby preventing its aggregation.
biological_consequence: TDP-43 NLS recognition by Importin-α/β → Translocation into nucleus → Maintenance of nuclear TDP-43 pool and function
Impaired Importin-α/β binding (due to mutations or PTMs in NLS) → Reduced nuclear import & increased cytoplasmic concentration → TDP-43 aggregation → Neurotoxicity
specific_effects: The TDP-43 NLS engages Importin-α through a bipartite mechanism involving both major and minor binding sites.
Binding of Importin-α sterically hinders the dimerization interface of the TDP-43 N-terminal domain, antagonizing its aggregation.
Mutations or post-translational modifications near the NLS can reduce binding affinity for Importin-α, leading to cytoplasmic mislocalization.

evidence.paper_title: Recognition of the TDP-43 nuclear localization signal by importin α1/β

mechanism: Importin-α, as part of the Importin-α/β heterodimer, recognizes and binds to the bipartite nuclear localization signal (NLS) of TDP-43, mediating its active transport from the cytoplasm into the nucleus through the nuclear pore complex.
effect: This interaction is essential for maintaining the predominantly nuclear localization of TDP-43. Binding of Importin-α to the TDP-43 NLS also has a chaperone-like activity, disrupting the dimerization of TDP-43's N-terminal domain and thereby preventing its aggregation.
summary: TDP43 activates Importin-α to modulate tdp-43 nuclear import, ultimately affecting maintenance of nuclear tdp-43 pool and function.
